About

Hi, I’m SeongHyun Kristine Seo!

Through multiple projects in the manufacturing sector, I’ve become deeply motivated by solving real-world problems with field-generated data. This has been the main driver of my professional growth.

My current research interests focus on reliable AI/ML for real-world operations, including time-series forecasting, multimodal time series, control & planning, and post-deployment model maintenance (e.g., monitoring and retraining).

I’m currently an AI/ML Researcher Intern at Boeing AI (BKETC, Seoul, South Korea), aiming to build sustainable and autonomous ML systems for industrial applications.

Check out my latest CV (PDF)

Experience

AI/ML Researcher Intern
Boeing AI
Aug 2025 — Present
  • Built time series forecasting models to predict future quality risks and detect early warning signals in aircraft manufacturing.
  • Developed causal inference / causal discovery analyses to identify root causes of warning-level events.
  • Collaborated with global teammates to prototype an automated reporting system and iteratively improve it with stakeholder feedback.
Graduate Research Student
Technometrics Lab
Sep 2022 — Aug 2025
  • Researched concept drift detection and adaptive retraining strategies for production ML systems (MLOps).
  • Presented at multiple international conferences; submitted journal papers.
  • Filed a patent on AI model retraining through feature store and data store updates.
Research Assistant
Hyundai Research Institute
Sep 2022 — Feb 2023

  • Summarized findings into report-ready deliverables.
